AJ Loehr
Python Engineer For Hire

About Me

I am a graduate of York College of Pennsylvania where I recently recieved my Bachelors of Science for Computer Science. Recently I just completed a successful internship at York Imperial Plastics where I served as an IT Intern. While here, I created new press monitoring and data collection softwares, as well as assisted in various IT support tasks around the factory. I helped with everything from internet connection problems to hardware issues and everything in between. I also helped to maintain and develop the companies Microsoft Access database.

Currently, I am serving as a part time Intern with a mobile app called ZeerSafe. At ZeerSafe I have been assisting in researching solutions and helping to lay out plans for future development and implementation of new features.

Accomplishments

  • Built press monitoring software in Python that successfully transfers data produced by the press to a database automatically without any human interaction.
  • Built an information collection form for various positions, basically eliminating that paperwork and streamlining the data collection process.
  • Troubleshot countless IT issues throughout the factory.

Interests

My personal interests include:

  • Data Science. I've always wondered how companies use our data to make suggestions and target advertisements, so naturally Data Science has been an interest of mine for a while.
  • Reviving Old Computers. One of my favorite things to do with old computers is seeing the difference that some new parts and a new operating system can make in a computers performance.
  • Linux. I started using Linux at the beginning of my junior year and I've been in love ever since. I am currently using Manjaro.
  • Fly Fishing. Nothing technical or special about it, I just enjoy it and I am not a robot that does nothing but computeres 24/7 ;)

Projects

    Recent Projects

  • Home Price Predictor in Python - I recently completed an independent study for my school where I chose to explore different machine learning algorithms to see how accurate they can be when it comes to predicting home prices based on a given set of data. I found that K-Nearest Neighbors worked very well with my data set, and my implementation was given ranges of prices of houses and could place a house in the correct price range with a consistent %90+ accuracy.
  • Java Text Based Web Adventure Game - For my Software Engineering class I worked with 2 other students to create a text based web application adventure game in Java. I was in charge of implementing all the classes my teammates created into a functioning game with a user friendly front end.
  • Cryptocurrency Price Predictor - For our senior design project, myself and 2 other students collaborated to create a desktop app in Python that uses third party API calls to collect cryptocurrency data and visualize and predict how the price has changed overtime and where it is predicted to go in the near future. My role in this project was to use the third party API calls to collect data from cryptocompare, and store the data in Airtable so that it may be easily accessed later by my teammates.

Current Projects

  • Repurposing old workstations into a functioning home server - I was given a few old PCs from work that were to be recycled so I am currently working on reusing parts from each PC to create one (hopefully soon) working Ubuntu home server for little to no cost.
  • Instaram Automation Bot in Python - I took some source code for an open source Instagram bot and I am currently working on adding onto it so that the bot will behave more randomly as to not trigger any Instagram bot filters. I also plan on adding automated posting in the near future. Ideally I would be able to run this bot on my repurposed home server one day.
